instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
threads.message:
Hi, 

no history on this one. No water damage as far as I can see. <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> measures 0.007V in diode mode or 18 Ohms. 

I've removed L6995 to see which side is shorted - system side it is. 

I've injected 1V into the <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and the current draw was around 600mA, pointing at <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, which was removed after. 

Now with 1V injected the current draw is around 65mA and SMC gets barely warm. I don't see anything else on camera. 

What should be my next step?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
threads.message: Inject 3.4 volts and see what gets hot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
threads.message: Can I damage SMC like that? Cause on one other board, I injected 3V and SMC could be bad right now...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
threads.message: If the SMC is dead, it doesn't matter if you inject .5 volts or 3.4 volts, it will be dead. PP3v42 is not really rail to worry on voltage as long as you don't go above 3.42. PPBUS is the rail you have to be careful of because of the CPU and its high side fets.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
threads.message:
Nor even 4V on 3V42 rail will damage anything.
As general rule, do not exceed 120% of the nominal voltage.
Always start injecting with low voltage and go up slowly...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
threads.message: I've injected 3.4V, nothing heats up except SMC, barely, 32C.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
threads.message: If the SMC is heating, remove it and see if the short goes away. Sounds like a shorted SMC

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
threads.message:
SMC is removed, there is no short on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>. 

I need to get another SMC, right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
threads.message: They're are very hard to get. I was expecting this answer, but a tiny part of me was hoping for: Try reballing first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
threads.message:
You can locate corresponding pins of the SMC for 3V42, as ground pins too.
Then check between these chip pads (out of board).
If you still get low value, forget about reballing...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
threads.message: Best to get a donor I usually order 2-3 to make sure I get one with a decent SMC

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
threads.message:
[USER="1153"]JohnB8812[/USER] Where do you get them? eBay?
[USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] Just checked, it's still shorted. Around 80 Ohms. Oh well...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
threads.message:
I've got "good" scrap boards on eBay from galaxyelectronics2015 seller.
You can get better quote closing deal outside eBay.
Contact seller directly with PM, or through Skype ID, Paul Lee...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
threads.message:
Thanks! 
How about used SMC's from Aliexpress?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
threads.message:
Only from donor boards.
I never ordered SMC from Aliexpress.
But actualy I prefer to buy chips from Aliexpress instead of eBay.
They send all with tracking number and have good buyer protection now.
However, never buy new SMC chips.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> short (another one)
threads.message:
Agreed. 
I'll try my luck with Aliexpress then if they reply that chips were good pulled.
